messages: e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (08:02): hello world
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (08:02): i finally sent my last comments on widgets-reqs, i'm very sorry about the delay in commenting
c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 (08:13): Timeless, thanks!!!!
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (08:14): um, dev.w3.org doesn't like me
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (08:14): otherwise i was going to try to read landscape or something
c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 (08:15): Nah, leave the landscape for now
c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 (08:15): If you can help me patch a few of the holes in the packaging, that would be greatly appriciated
c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 (08:15): let me check in the latest draft
c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 (08:16): hmmm... looks like dev.w3.org is down
c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 (08:16): I'll email sysreq
c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 (08:21): Timeless, I still need you to respond to the other comments I made in response to the discussions we had on gmail chat. Is that ok?
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (08:24): um, lemme see if i can find it
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (08:25): err, and url for packaging? it doesn't seem to be in http://dev.w3.org/2006/waf/
c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 (08:25): Yeah, dev is down. I've emailed the W3C team
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (08:26): starves
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (08:28): can you give me a hint for how i can find your reply/pending bits
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (08:28): my mailbox isn't exactly well organized :)
c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 (08:28): no probs. one sec (or just search for from: c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774)
c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 (08:29): This is the email
c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 (08:29): http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/public-webapps/2008AprJun/0440.html
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (08:30): that's in 21-37 i guess :)
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (08:30): gives up and uses the web link
c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 (08:30): subject is [widgets] Timeless' Widgets Requirements LC
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (08:31): yeah, that worked better :)
c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 (08:33): hehe, reading your current comments... noting "which are just embarrassing" and "this doesn't look like something that should be published". LOL :D
c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 (08:35): My response to spelling mistakes is "I put them in on purpose to keep you on your toes:)"
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (08:39): i had a doc with something like "it is expected that no one will read this"
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (08:40): i think i actually had one person complain
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (08:40): i can't remember how many months it took before i got that one person
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (08:40): and it was from a publication group, not from the approval group
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (08:41): so i only need to deal w/ COMMENTS and QUESTIONS, i hope
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (08:41): doesn't have time to read the rest
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (08:44): sighs
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (08:44): the problem i have w/ commenting is people ask me to comment on their comments
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (08:44): it's a never ending battle
c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 (08:44): hehe. Yeah, sorry about that.
c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 (08:44): Promise not to do another round
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (08:44): i told someone to change an alarm clock pick sound dialog title
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (08:45): so they changed it
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (08:45): and sent me the new thing
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (08:45): which had an "add sound" option
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (08:45): sadly, "add" means "replace current custom sound", not "add another custom sound"
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (08:45): (there's no "remove")
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (08:45): so i decided to read their spec
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (08:45): which had something like 'beet' in one of the other human displayable strings
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (08:45): as a pair to 'been'
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (08:46): at which point i decided that i probably should read all of their strings...
c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 (08:55): woops. Yeah, once you go down one rat hole...
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (08:57): hrm, i need a way to say "ok" which doesn't sound like "ok" :o
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (08:57): "understood"?
c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 (09:05): understood works
c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 (09:05): or "whatever..."
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (09:06): hrm, interesting
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (09:07): motivation is no longer sentences
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (09:07): much better :)
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (09:07): wait, it kinda is
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (09:07): please lose the '.'s at the end :)
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (09:07): or oh!
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (09:07): yeah sorry, i'm generally reading markup in text/plain
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (09:08): sighs
c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 (09:08): I'll add the "and" to those
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (09:08): ok
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (09:09): sorry, reading html hurts my eyes :)
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (09:09): i was actually reading the thing in a <textarea> using the windows High Contrast Black theme (in the dark)
c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 (09:09): You know, they have these things called "browsers" that actually render the HTML
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (09:09): yeah, those are what hurt my eyes :)
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (09:10): all these things in italics, and strnage lines all over the place...
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (09:10): and fancy colors....
c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 (09:10): Well, the aim was to have a pretty spec even to distract from the fact that the content might be crap.
c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 (09:12): suddenly remembers all this is being logged >.<
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (09:12): and you wonder why i don't like using irc for this stuff :)
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (09:12): i'm not saying that html is a bad thing... i do work on a browser after all
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (09:13): it's just that sometimes when you're tired and trying to review language, the last thing you want are distractions
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (09:13): the good thinig about html is that it can degrade to plain text
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (09:13): unlike some of the other formats i've dealt with of late, which make reviewing much more painful
c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 (09:13): yeah, I totally get that. I use my screen reader for proof reading.
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (09:13): heh
c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 (09:14): Seriously, using both audio and visual helps quite a bit (in my case at least).
c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 (09:15): People think I'm rude when I go to meeting because I always have my headset on, but that's only because I use my screen reader religiously.
c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 (09:16): Maybe I'll start carrying around a blind walking cane so people will not bother me.
e29be37c2febc43a0d21a1f8efa351af (09:17): heh
c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 (09:23): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2, any chance you would check what's up with http://dev.w3.org?

c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 (09:25): thanks Mike
c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 (09:25): no, just can't access it through the web... have not tried checking in

c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 (09:26): Attempting a check in

a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (09:26): yeah, everything seems to be working from command line OK

a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (09:27): yeah, so seems to be a problem just with the dev.w3 web server
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (09:27): anyway, will wake up the system team
c5e3539121c4944f2bbe097b425ee774 (09:27): I sent them an email (sysreq)

a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (09:28): well, then we just got to wait I guess

a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (09:28): I don't have shell access to that machine myself
